Title: German I
Description: Introductory German. Includes listening, reading, writing, and speaking. Offered all terms. Entrance exam required.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: German II
Description: ContinuesGER 101. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: German III
Description: ContinuesGER 102. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: German IV
Description: Intermediate German. Includes grammar review, listening, speaking, and reading. Recommended for students who wish to attain oral competence. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: German V
Description: ContinuesGER 201. Offered all terms.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Advanced Writing and Speaking
Description: This course provides advanced practice in written and oral communication, including journalistic, professional, and creative writing. Examines contemporary cultural contexts through media and news. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Not repeatable for credit

Title: Introduction to Language for the Professions
Description: This course provides an introduction to communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Introduction to Identities and Communities
Description: This courses provides an introduction to the analysis of individual and collective identities, including issues of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, class, nationality, and religion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Introduction to Power and Resistance
Description: This course provides an introduction to the analysis of power relations and issues of (in)equality rooted in contemporary political and socio-economic systems. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Introduction to Language, Media, and Society
Description: This course provides an introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

Title: Advanced Grammar and Translation
Description: German 410 provides advanced grammar instruction and fosters translation and communication skills within a contemporary cultural context. The content ofGER 410may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits
Prerequisites: GER 310 [Min Grade: C] and (GER 320 [Min Grade: C] or GER 330 [Min Grade: C] or GER 340 [Min Grade: C] or GER 350 [Min Grade: C])

Description: This course provides advanced communication skills in areas such as contemporary business, health, and law in a culturally sensitive fashion. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in German.
Repeat Status: Can be repeated 8 times for 27 credits

The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in German.
